detaileddescription.para: LTE network is ready to be used.
CA certificates need to be initialized.

sectiondef.header: LWM2M carrier library event deferred reasons.

detaileddescription.para: Failed to connect to bootstrap server.

sectiondef.header: LWM2M carrier library event error codes.

detaileddescription.para: < No error. Failed to connect to the LTE network.
Failed to disconnect from the LTE network.

simplesect.para: These values are only valid for the LWM2M Device INTERNAL_BATTERY if present.

briefdescription.para: Initialize the LWM2M carrier library.

parameterdescription.para: Configuration parameters for the library.

simplesect.para: The library does not copy the contents of pointers in the config parameters. The application has to make sure that the provided parameters are valid throughout the application lifetime (i. e. placed in static memory or in flash).
The first time this function is called after a modem firmware update, (FOTA) it may take several seconds to return in order to complete the procedure.
0 on success, negative error code on error.

briefdescription.para: LWM2M carrier library main function.

detaileddescription.para: This is a non-return function, intended to run on a separate thread.

briefdescription.para: Function to read all time parameters.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to time since Epoch in seconds.
Pointer to UTC offset in minutes.
Pointer to null-terminated timezone string pointer.

briefdescription.para: Function to read current UTC time.

simplesect.para: This function can be implemented by the application, if custom time management is needed.
Current UTC time since Epoch in seconds.

briefdescription.para: Function to read offset to UTC time.

simplesect.para: This function can be implemented by the application, if custom time management is needed.
UTC offset in minutes.

briefdescription.para: Function to read timezone.

simplesect.para: This function can be implemented by the application, if custom time management is needed.
Null-terminated timezone string pointer, IANA Timezone (TZ) database format.

briefdescription.para: Function to write current UTC time (LWM2M server write operation)

simplesect.para: This function can be implemented by the application, if custom time management is needed.

parameterdescription.para: Time since Epoch in seconds.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative error code on error.

briefdescription.para: Function to write UTC offset (LWM2M server write operation)

simplesect.para: This function can be implemented by the application, if custom time management is needed.

parameterdescription.para: UTC offset in minutes.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative error code on error.

briefdescription.para: Function to write timezone (LWM2M server write operation).

simplesect.para: This function can be implemented by the application, if custom time management is needed.

parameterdescription.para: Null-terminated timezone string pointer.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative error code on error.

briefdescription.para: LWM2M carrier library event handler.

detaileddescription.para: This function will be called by the LWM2M carrier library whenever some event significant for the application occurs.

simplesect.para: This function has to be implemented by the application.

parameterdescription.para: LWM2M carrier event that occurred.

simplesect.para: In case of LWM2M_CARRIER_EVENT_REBOOT events if non-zero is returned, the LwM2M carrier library will not reboot the device. The application should to reboot at the earliest convenient time.

briefdescription.para: Set the available power sources supported and used by the LWM2M device.

simplesect.para: It is necessary to call this function before any other device power source related functions listed in this file, as any updates of voltage/current measurements performed on power sources that have not been reported will be discarded.
Upon consecutive calls of this function, the corresponding current and voltage measurements will be reset to 0. Similarly, the battery status will be set to UNKNOWN and the battery level to 0%.

parameterdescription.para: Array of available device power sources.
Number of power sources currently used by the device.
If the reported number of power sources is bigger than the maximum supported.
If one or more of the power sources are not supported.
If the available power sources have been set successfully.

briefdescription.para: Set or update the latest voltage measurements made on one of the available device power sources.

simplesect.para: The voltage measurement needs to be specified in millivolts (mV) and is to be assigned to one of the available power sources.

parameterdescription.para: Power source to which the measurement corresponds.
Voltage measurement expressed in mV.
If the power source is not supported.
If the power source is not listed as an available power source.
If the voltage measurements have been updated successfully.

briefdescription.para: Set or update the latest current measurements made on one of the available device power sources.

simplesect.para: The current measurement needs to be specified in milliamperes (mA) and is to be assigned to one of the available power sources.

parameterdescription.para: Power source to which the measurement corresponds.
Current measurement expressed in mA.
If the power source is not supported.
If the power source is not listed as an available power source.
If the current measurements have been updated successfully.

briefdescription.para: Set or update the latest battery level (internal battery).

simplesect.para: The battery level is to be specified as a percentage, hence values outside the range 0-100 will be ignored.
The value is only valid for the Device internal battery if present.

parameterdescription.para: Internal battery level percentage.
If the specified battery level lies outside the 0-100% range.
If internal battery is not listed as an available power source.
If the battery level has been updated successfully.

briefdescription.para: Set or update the latest battery status (internal battery).

simplesect.para: The value is only valid for the Device internal battery.

parameterdescription.para: Internal battery status to be reported.
If the battery status is not supported.
If internal battery is not listed as an available power source.
If the battery status has been updated successfully.

briefdescription.para: Set the LWM2M device type.

simplesect.para: Type of the LWM2M device specified by the manufacturer.

parameterdescription.para: Null terminated string specifying the type of the LWM2M device.
If the input argument is a NULL pointer or an empty string.
If the input string is too long.
If it was not possible to allocate memory storage to hold the string.
If the device type has been set successfully.

briefdescription.para: Set the LWM2M device hardware version.

simplesect.para: LWM2M device hardware version.

parameterdescription.para: Null terminated string specifying the hardware version of the LWM2M device.
If the input argument is a NULL pointer or an empty string.
If the input string is too long.
If it was not possible to allocate memory storage to hold the string.
If the hardware version has been set successfully.

briefdescription.para: Set the LWM2M device software version.

simplesect.para: High level device software version (application).

parameterdescription.para: Null terminated string specifying the current software version of the LWM2M device.
If the input argument is a NULL pointer or an empty string.
If the input string is too long.
If it was not possible to allocate memory storage to hold the string.
If the software version has been set successfully.

briefdescription.para: Update the device object instance error code by adding an individual error.

simplesect.para: Upon initialization of the device object instance, the error code is specified as 0, indicating no error. The error code is to be updated whenever a new error occurs.
If the reported error is NO_ERROR, all existing error codes will be reset.
If the reported error is already present, the error code will remain unchanged.

parameterdescription.para: Individual error to be added.
If the error code is not supported.
If the error code has been added successfully.

briefdescription.para: Update the device object instance error code by removing an individual error.

simplesect.para: Upon initialization of the device object instance, the error code is specified as 0, indicating no error. The error code is to be updated whenever an error is no longer present. When all the errors are removed, the error code is specified as 0, hence indicating no error again.

parameterdescription.para: Individual error code to be removed.
If the error code is not supported.
If the error to be removed is not present on the error code list.
If the error has been removed successfully.

briefdescription.para: Set the total amount of storage space to store data and software in the LWM2M Device.

simplesect.para: The value is expressed in kilobytes (kB).

parameterdescription.para: Total amount of storage space in kilobytes.
It the reported value is bigger than INT32_MAX.
If the total amount of storage space has been set successfully.

briefdescription.para: Read the estimated current available amount of storage space to store data and software in the LWM2M Device.

simplesect.para: This function must be implemented by the application in order to support the reporting of memory free, otherwise the returned value will be 0.
Available amount of storage space expressed in kB.

briefdescription.para: Read the Identity field of a given Portfolio object instance.

simplesect.para: If the provided buffer is NULL, the function will perform a dry run to determine the required buffer size (including the null terminator).

parameterdescription.para: Portfolio object instance identifier.
Type of Identity field to be read.
Buffer where the null-terminated response will be stored.
Length of the provided buffer. Will return the number of bytes of the full response.
If the instance does not exist.
If the provided buffer length reference is NULL or the identity type is invalid.
If the provided buffer is too small.
If the operation was successful.

briefdescription.para: Set the corresponding Identity field of a Portfolio object instance to a given value.

parameterdescription.para: Portfolio object instance identifier.
Type of Identity field to be written.
Null terminated string to be written into the Identity field.
If the specified object instance ID corresponds to the Primary Host identity.
If the input argument is a NULL pointer or an empty string, or the identity type is invalid.
If the instance does not exist.
If the input string is too long.
If it was not possible to allocate memory storage to hold the string.
If the Identity field has been updated successfully.

briefdescription.para: Create a new instance of the Portfolio object.

parameterdescription.para: The identifier to be used for the new instance.
If it was not possible to create the instance because the maximum number of supported object instances has already been reached.
If the provided instance identifier is already in use.
If the instance has been created successfully.
